Ecclesiasticus *__28.1: He that seeketh to revenge himself, shall find vengeance from the Lord, and he will surely keep his sins in remembrance.
Ecclesiasticus *__28.2: Forgive thy neighbour if he hath hurl thee: and then shall thy sins be forgiven to thee when thou prayest.
Ecclesiasticus *__28.3: Man to man reserveth anger, and doth he seek remedy of God?
Ecclesiasticus *__28.4: He hath no mercy on a man like himself, and doth he entreat for his own sins?
Ecclesiasticus *__28.5: He that is but flesh, nourisheth anger, and doth he ask forgiveness of God? who shall obtain pardon for his sins?
Ecclesiasticus *__28.6: Remember thy last things, and let enmity cease:
Ecclesiasticus *__28.7: For corruption and death hang over<u>in his commandments</u>.
Ecclesiasticus *__28.8: Remember the fear of God, and be not angry with thy neighbour.
Ecclesiasticus *__28.9: Remember the covenant of the most High, and overlook the ignorance of thy neighbour.
Ecclesiasticus *__28.10: Refrain from strife, and thou shalt diminish thy sins:
Ecclesiasticus *__28.11: For a passionate man kindleth strife, and a sinful man will trouble his friends, and bring in debate in the midst of them that are at peace.
Ecclesiasticus *__28.12: For as the wood of the forest is, so the fire burneth: and as a man's strength is, so shall his anger be, and according to his riches he shall increase his anger.
Ecclesiasticus *__28.13: A hasty contention kindleth a fire: and a hasty quarrel sheddeth blood: and a tongue that beareth witness bringeth death.
Ecclesiasticus *__28.14: If thou blow the spark, it shall burn as a fire: and if thou spit upon it, it shall be quenched: both come out of the mouth.
Ecclesiasticus *__28.15: The whisperer and the double tongued is accursed: for he hath troubled many that were at peace.
Ecclesiasticus *__28.16: The tongue of a third person hath disquieted many, and scattered them from nation to nation.
Ecclesiasticus *__28.17: It hath destroyed the strong cities of the rich, and hath overthrown the houses of great men.
Ecclesiasticus *__28.18: It hath cut in pieces the forces of people, and undone strong nations.
Ecclesiasticus *__28.19: The tongue of a third person hath cast out valiant women, and deprived them of their labours.
Ecclesiasticus *__28.20: He that hearkeneth to it, shall never have rest, neither shall he have a friend in whom he may repose.
Ecclesiasticus *__28.21: The stroke of a whip maketh a blue mark: but the stroke of the tongue will break the bones.
Ecclesiasticus *__28.22: Many have fallen by the edge of the sword, but not so many as have perished by their own tongue.
Ecclesiasticus *__28.23: Blessed is he that is defended from a wicked tongue, that hath not passed into the wrath thereof, and that hath not drawn the yoke thereof, and hath not been bound in its bands.
Ecclesiasticus *__28.24: For its yoke is a yoke of iron: and its bands are bands of brass.
Ecclesiasticus *__28.25: The death thereof is a most evil death: and hell is preferable to it.
Ecclesiasticus *__28.26: Its continuance shall not be for a long time, but it shall possess the ways of the unjust: and the just shall not be burnt with its flame.
Ecclesiasticus *__28.27: They that forsake God shall fall into it, and it shall burn in them, and shall not be quenched, and it shall be sent upon them as a lion, and as a leopard it shall tear them.
Ecclesiasticus *__28.28: Hedge in thy ears with thorns, hear not a wicked tongue, and make doors and bars to thy mouth.
Ecclesiasticus *__28.29: Melt down thy gold and silver, and make a balance for thy words, and a just bridle for thy mouth:
Ecclesiasticus *__28.30: And take heed lest thou slip with thy tongue, and fall in the sight of thy enemies who lie in wait for thee, and thy fall be incurable unto death.
